availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Richardson (Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror)

body.p: Trigg County, Kentucky, farmer and juror. Virginia native. Married to Elizabeth J. Carson Richardson in Trigg County, Kentucky, on November 23, 1852. Father of Alice Richardson and Robert M. Richardson. Farmer in Trigg County in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Trigg County in 1860. Juror in the Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Thomas B. Wadlington in Caldwell County, on December 8, 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, Cadiz, District, p. 92.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Trigg County, p. 376A.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Trigg County Marriages, Film #000321335, p. 148.
KYR-0001-020-0001.
